# UIDocumentBrowserTransitionController

**Class**

An object that implements the standard loading and transition animations for a document browser.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor class UIDocumentBrowserTransitionController
```

## Overview

Each transition controller is associated with a document in the document browser. The transition controller can provide two separate animation sequences for this document:

- If you set the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDocumentBrowserTransitionController/loadingProgress] property, the document browser shows the loading progress in the document’s thumbnail.
- If you set the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDocumentBrowserTransitionController/targetView] property, the transition controller acts as a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIViewControllerAnimatedTransitioning] object, providing a custom transition between the document’s thumbnail and the target view. This transitioning object can be used both when presenting and when dismissing the document.

You don’t instantiate instances of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDocumentBrowserTransitionController] yourself. Instead, call the document browser’s [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDocumentBrowserViewController/transitionController(forDocumentURL:)] method to get a transition controller for the specified document.



## Animating transitions

- **loadingProgress**: A progress object that tracks a document as it loads.
- **targetView**: The target view for transition animations when presenting or dismissing the transition controller’s document.

## Related Documentation

- **UIDocumentBrowserViewController**: A view controller for browsing and performing actions on documents that you store locally and in the cloud.

## Animating transitions

- **transitionController(forDocumentAt:)**: Creates a transition controller that provides the standard system-loading and segue animations for the document browser.
